Can you create for me an Apple Notes Mark Down File that nests these things in ?

2025-04-21T17:32:17.692797Z assistant

Absolutely heres a clean Apple Notescompatible Markdown version of your Hawk Eye The Rapper Lyric Book, fully nested and ready for pasting straight into Notes or MWeb.

#  Hawk Eye The Rapper  Lyric Book

##  01 Full Disclosure (2020)
- 01  [Swordfish](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/01_swordfish.ipynb)
- 02  [Mic Check](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/02_mic_check.ipynb)
- 03  [Shakur](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/03_shakur.ipynb)
- 04  [Last One Left](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/04_last_one_left.ipynb)
- 05  [Full Disclosure](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/05_full_disclosure.ipynb)
- 06  [Lifted](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/06_lifted.ipynb)
- 07  [Fuck Society](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/07_fuck_society.ipynb)
- 08  [Ashes](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/08_ashes.ipynb)
- 09  [Haunted](01_Full_Disclosure_2020/09_haunted.ipynb)

2025-04-21T17:33:50.326718Z assistant

Got it what youre wanting is a nested Apple Notes structure where each track name is an internal note link that, when clicked, opens a separate Apple Note for you to write or paste into. Unfortunately, Apple Notes doesnt support clickable intra-note links to other Apple Notes automatically from a Markdown file.

But heres what we can do:

Option 1: Manual Apple Notes Nesting (Recommended for Notes App)

We make a top-level Note for your "Lyric Book Index", and from there you:

  1. Create individual notes manually for each song.
  2. Title them the same as the ones in the list.
  3. In the index note, manually use the "Add Link" feature in Apple Notes:
    • Highlight the song title
    • Right click Add Link...
    • Type the note title you created Apple will autocomplete and link to the note.

This gives you perfect internal linking, searchable, syncable, and editable across Mac + iPhone.

Option 2: Use a Markdown Notes App (like Obsidian or MWeb)

You can:

  • Drop the structure into Obsidian or MWeb.
  • Click on each [song name](relative_link) and it will open that .md file.
  • Perfect for typing lyrics and saving versions.

I can generate the full folder structure for Obsidian or MWeb with pre-linked Markdown files if you'd like let me know.

Fast Start Option: Apple Notes Setup Instructions

If you go with Apple Notes, heres your quick-start process:

  1. Copy that into a new note titled Lyric Book Index.
  2. Create a new note for each song (just title them exactly the same).
  3. Go back to your index, highlight Swordfish Add Link Type Swordfish Select it Done.

Rinse and repeat.

When you're creating the Apple Notes manually, you dont need the hyphen (-) unless you want it for personal visual organization. Here's the difference:

Recommended for Apple Notes:

Just use the clean track name:

  • Swordfish
  • Mic Check
  • Shakur

Apple Notes doesnt require numbering or special formatting for search or linking. It works great just using the title of the track as the note title.

Optional for Structured Styling (e.g. in Files or Markdown apps like Obsidian):

Use the stylized version with the track number:

  • 01 - Swordfish
  • 02 - Mic Check

This is helpful if youre working with file systems or markdown folders that need sorting.

TL;DR:

For Apple Notes:
Name them Swordfish, Mic Check, etc.

For file systems or export folders:
Go with 01 - Swordfish, etc., to keep order intact.

Want me to regenerate a cleaner Apple Notes .zip using only track names as file titles?

2025-04-21T17:58:23.244496Z assistant

Ah now I get you!

You're asking whether, when creating your Apple Notes manually, you should title them like:

  • 01 - Swordfish
    or just:
  • Swordfish

Answer: Either works but here's the best practice:

If you're using an index note to link to individual notes inside Apple Notes, then:

Use just the song title:

Swordfish
Mic Check
Shakur
...

Because when you go to Add Link... inside Apple Notes, it looks for note titles, and keeping them clean (just the track name) makes linking faster and cleaner.

But if you're organizing externally (e.g., in Finder or a Markdown app):

Then the 01 - Swordfish format is perfect for:

  • Sorting
  • File naming consistency
  • Track ordering

TL;DR:
For Apple Notes titles use just Swordfish
For file system or Obsidian notes use 01 - Swordfish.md

Let me know if you want me to rename anything else accordingly!
